On Mon, Oct 26, 2009 at 7:02 PM, Solomon Duskis <sduskis@...> wrote:

> If you're already using the URL, what practical difference does it make to
> have '/resource;type=application/xml' or '/resource.xml'?  IMHO, The .xml
> extension is better understood.
>

It removes an unnecessary layer of indirection (e.g. mime.types).

That said, I don't particularly like either for reasons already discussed.

Sam

--000e0cd2178ee92e930476da6e94
